Credit-Based
Details: https://docs.movisens.com/movisensXS/faq/#credits (also, the dashboard has a Billing page)
Also, you can request quote for features like Analysis Dashboard for XS.

Movisens - Notes: Based on their News (https://www.movisens.com/en/news/) and Recent Changes (https://docs.movisens.com/movisensXS/recent_changes).
Based on their News (https://www.movisens.com/en/news/) and Recent Changes (https://docs.movisens.com/movisensXS/recent_changes).

Feature Name: Interface to create and manage a study
Workspace to manage and organize multiple studies
Movisens - Notes: You'll have one organization and for each organization, you can have multiple users. You can define permissions of those users in each study of that organization.
3 sample studies

Feature Name: Publicly share study templates with the community
Pair researcher's device for testing study flow

Movisens - Notes: Respects device's localization. You can also contribute in translating via Transifex.

Feature Name: Support for eligibility screening of participants before they are enrolled in the study
Record responses to eligibility screening both for eligible and ineligible participants

Movisens - Notes: Each participant has a uinque QR code which includes an auth token. They can scan within the app.

Feature Name: Enrollment available to the general public
Limit enrollment to invited participants only
Send email to invited participants & follow up reminders
Interface to view list of study participants
Filtering participants based on any of their data (e.g. notifications, survey responses, etc.)
Automatically calculate start and end of participation for each enrollment.

Movisens - Notes: After they're coupled/joined, you can only change the end time. But before that, you can modify both start and end times.

Feature Name: Direct chat room between a participant and a researcher
Direct chat room between two researchers of the study.
Group chat rooms between one or more researcher and a participant
Movisens - Notes: "Enable Messaging" as part of "Study Running" node in the sampling section.

Feature Name: Group chat room between all researchers of the study
Log all actions taken by a participant
MetricWire - Notes: Events that do not have a trigger associated with them will not show up under Survey/Triggers/View Logs. You can find them under the Participant Activity tab for each participant when you click "View Activity" for a survey.

Feature Name: Log all actions taken by a researcher
For any changes, specify the date, time, and user
For any change include the old value and new value
Capturing the reason for a given action

Movisens - Notes: The first page of their consent section is about the app itself and also asks if they want to send anonymous crash reports. Then the study consent will show. Text with few formattings supported. And they have "Participant has to sign informed consent with his signature." setting which asks the participants to sign with their finger signature.

Feature Name:
Mid-Study Consent

This is referred to the process where the study protocol changes in the middle,
and the researcher has to send an additional consent form to participants to
sign before they continue on the modifed protocol.
Movisens - Notes: Although you won't be able to publish all changes at once (like a study version). If you change the protocol and save, and then the participant syncs before you get to updating the consent, the participant would see the old consent.

Feature Name:
Consent through legally acceptable representative

Can consent be provided via a guardian, parent, or caretaker?
Define multiple arms in a study
MetricWire - Notes: MW uses Block terminology for Arm.

Feature Name: Define conditions on which participants should be assgined to each arm
Central interface to manage study notifications
Define notification templates to be used across the study

MetricWire - Notes: MW uses SMS medium for offline cases.
Movisens - Notes: Via "Alarm" sampling node.
Via "Alarm" sampling node and conditional sampling nodes.

Feature Name: Support for sending one-off notifications to one or more participants
MetricWire - Notes: Options include Push Notification, SMS and automated Phone Call.
Movisens - Notes: Via "Message All" which sends a chat message basically.

Feature Name: Support for sending notifications to researchers
Sending notifications before or after a certain event
MetricWire - Notes: A notification is sent before an activity is triggered
Movisens - Notes: Via "Alarm" sampling node.

Feature Name: Piping study variables in the notification content

Movisens - Notes: Via "Alarm" sampling node.

Feature Name: Sending notifications via chat apps such as WhatsApp or Telegram
Track delivery of notifications and report their success or failure
MetricWire - Notes: While it doesn't exactly show notifications status, it is recognizable that push notifications aren't being delivered. If you select "View Activity" for a participant, a large number of "app_launched" events indicate that the app is frequently being forced closed. You should tell the participant not to force close the app to avoid the system being unable to deliver survey notifications.

Feature Name: Show notifications scheduled in the future

Movisens - Notes: Via "Alarm" sampling node.
Via "Alarm" sampling node.
Via "Alarm" sampling node.
Couldn't find an easy flow to achieve this.

Via "Button Pressed" sampling node. You can adjust label and order (the order of the buttons on the home screen). The higher the order/weight, the deeper it sinks. Also, you can set it as a one-time button. And you can define groups for buttons using Button Group (on request). Groups can be minimized.

Called "Incomplete" or "Timed out". Via "Timeout Interval" property (after how many seconds of inactivity a timeout warning will be shown) of Form sample node. You can set it for each form TL. Also, you can set length of the timeout alarm in seconds for each form TL. The alarm will trigger whether the form is open or not.

Feature Name: Time-based Activity Triggering - Support for relative and absolute time
Movisens - Notes: For the relative part (registration date only), you can use "Sampling Day" combined with other sampling nodes.

Feature Name: Time-based Activity Triggering - Support for exact time vs. random within a time-window
Movisens - Notes: For the random part, only the time (HH:mm) is supported. This event fires randomly a specified number of prompts in the specified time period and triggers the successor nodes. It also supports a Minimum Time Between Prompts. And you can specify the period using mutable values. The random time trigger follows a stratified randomization instead of allowing random prompts at any possible time. It takes the set time frame and divides it equally to accommodate the number of required prompts. It’s within these smaller chunks that the random prompt appears, only governed by the minimum time between prompts.

Feature Name: Time-based Activity Triggering - Repeat logic (e.g. repeat daily, weekly, monthly, etc.)
Movisens - Notes: They have these sampling nodes: Weekday, Date Range, Time Range, Initial (fires only once after the previous node is true), Repeated (via defined interval and as long as the previous condition stays true)

Feature Name: Trigger activity based on time chosen by the participant (e.g. using a previous calendar question)
Movisens - Notes: Only on the time part (HH:mm) using "Time Range" sampling or "Participant Time Trigger" (on request, which allows you to repeat everday too) node.

Feature Name: Trigger activity based on another event from the current participant (e.g. survey completed)
Movisens - Notes: You can define Mutable Values after a form completion and use that value as a condition in triggering another form combined with "Immediatly" sampling node. Also, you can use "Delay" sampling node to delay triggering the next form or action.

Feature Name: Trigger activity based on another event from another participant
Create one-off sessions one at a time.

Movisens - Notes: On request. Called "Nearby Devices Condition"; a sampling node. It uses IBeacon standard. Also, it lets you specifiy Broadcast Signal (toggle), Scanning Interval, and Time Between Scans.

On request. Via "Geofence Trigger" or "Multi Geofence Trigger". This event fires if a given geofence or any of the given geofences was entered/left or the participant is staying in it over some time. Other then the geofence itself, you can specify whether the geofence should trigger the initial location of the participant dependent on the geofence.
For sections/questions, it's called "Visibility Rule". For sampling, it's a Check Mutable Value (on request).

Feature Name: Support for creating new variables and exporting them to be used within the study flow
Movisens - Notes: You can create them via "Mutable Value Editor" (on request), "Save answer as mutable value" for form questions (on request), and "Change Mutable Value" sampling node dynamically. Regarding the latter option, I'm not sure whether this means question responses linked to mutable values will be affected or not. You can set, increment, or decrement. You can define variables based on responses to these question types: Select One, Likert Scale, Visual Analog, Decimal, Number, Number Picker, Display Random Word, Text, Time, Date & Time; not Date.

Feature Name: Visual script editor for one-liner codes
Movisens - Notes: For sections/questions, it's called "Visibility Rule". For sampling, it's a Check Mutable Value (on request).

Feature Name: Query sessions based on participant, activity, time, or any combination
Export survey in a textual format

Movisens - Notes: You can print (CTRL+P). Not all details are included though.

Feature Name: Maintain versions across changes to survey
Publicly share survey templates with research community

Movisens - Notes: Using "Play Audio" Output item inside a Multi-Item Screen. Also, you can specify whether scrubbing (changing time in audio) is allowed: And the audio can have a headline.

Using "Display Image" Output item inside a Multi-Item Screen. And the image can have a headline. On their Pricing page, they say "Items which generate an answer inside your results will count as one credit (e.g. Display Image)".
On request. Using "Display Video" Output item inside a Multi-Item Screen. It displays a Video from SD-Card. Also, you can specify whether it should auto-start.

Feature Name: Question read-aloud option (for participants with reading difficulty)
Visualize responses to a question within the app
View past responses to a question while answering that question
Avicenna (Ethica) - Notes: You can use Piping to get the response to the last question and display it as part of the survey content.
Movisens - Notes: Via "Save answer as mutable value" and "Display Mutable Value" form item.

Feature Name: Set minimum & maximum display time for a question
Movisens - Notes: You can put the question inside a Multi-Item Screen and set the MIS's "Auto advance time" for the maximum display time. The items (questions) in that MIS must be marked as not required.

Feature Name: Exclude / Include an item in the survey
Movisens - Notes: WIP: Waiting for the comment on the feature name to be resolved.

Feature Name: Piping values into question content from current participant
Movisens - Notes: Via "Mutable Values" and "Display Mutable Value" form item.

Feature Name: Piping values into question content from other participant

Movisens - Notes: Called "Label". You will see them as a column header in your downloaded results table. Labels must start with a letter and can only consist of letters, numbers, "-", and "_". Labels are unique within the whole study. This differs from "Save answer as mutable value".
In some item formats (e.g. Visual Analog Scale) a default value is present. In this case the required field will be ignored.
Via a combination of Display Text, Play Audio, and other Output form items in one Multi-Item Screen.

Feature Name:
Ability to show participant's responses as part of the survey flow

This allows the survey to have a "question", or "item", that presents
 participant's past responses. For example, after the 5th question of
the survey, the researcher can show a list of all responses
participant has provided to a previous question.
Ability to show visualizations of participant's past responses as part of the survey flow

MetricWire - Notes: Text question types in MW do not have an enforced format option. However, each format has different question types (email, phone number, and percentage).

Feature Name: Text - Option to record audio instead of or in addition to typing

Movisens - Notes: Called "Select Many".

Feature Name: Multiple-Answer Question - Support different layouts (button, checkbox, dropdown)
Multiple-Answer Question - Using images as answer option

Movisens - Notes: Called "Select One".

Feature Name: Single-Answer Question - Support different layouts (button, radio-button, dropdown)
MetricWire - Notes: It's just a dropdown in MW for a single answer.

Feature Name: Single-Answer Question - Using images as answer option

Movisens - Notes: They have 2 question types for this: Number and Decimal.
On request and via "Number Picker" and not the Number or Decimal.

Feature Name: Number questions - customized interface for length
Number questions - customized interface for weight

Movisens - Notes: Called "Visual Analog".
On request. Called "Left and Right Values".

Feature Name: VAS - Text for left & right anchor
Movisens - Notes: Also, they have a Neutral anchor.

Feature Name: VAS - image for left & right anchor
VAS - show specific text based on selection
VAS - show specific image based on selection
VAS - Control appearance of slider thumb
VAS - Display participant's last answer to the question on the question's interface.
Avicenna (Ethica) - Notes: You can use Piping to get the response to the last question and display it as part of the survey content.

Movisens - Notes: As a separate form item called "Time".
As a separate form item called "Date".
As a separate form item called "Date & TIme".

Feature Name: Calendar - Support interval entry (duration, e.g. 15 minutes, 1h10m, etc.)
Movisens - Notes: Not supported as single question. We can achieve that via 2 questions inside a section, but the responses won't be durations; they'll be periods.

Feature Name: Calendar - Specify minimum and maximum value
Image question - Take photo vs. select from gallery
Movisens - Notes: You can't have both options in one question. They have 2 form items: "Choose Picture" (on request) and "Take Picture"

Feature Name: Audio question - Record vs. select from device
Movisens - Notes: Only recording is supported.

Feature Name: Video question - Record vs. select from device
Movisens - Notes: Only recording is supported.
Called "GeoPoint" and kinda forces you to keep the current location selected by the GPS/map.
You can't enter the code manually.
Some basic operations are supported on mutable values via "Change Mutable Value" sampling node. Then you can display that value using "Display Mutable Value" form item.
Called "Page Indicator" and you can adjust if for each form and TL in sampling.
Called "Multi-Item Screen".
You should enable/disable for each form TL separately.
You should enable/disable for each form TL separately. Questions that don't belong to any section (root questions) will be randomized. You can see such form as a form with one section.

Feature Name: Randomize answers within a question (for multiple-answer questions)
Randomly select a subset of sections
Movisens - Notes: On request. You should enable/disable for each form TL separately. You can show only the given count of all items in a stratified randomized order (if randomized is activated).

Feature Name: Randomly select a subset of questions within a section
Movisens - Notes: On request. You should enable/disable for each form TL separately. You can show only the given count of all items in a stratified randomized order (if randomized is activated). Questions that don't belong to any section (root questions) will be randomly selected. You can see such form as a form with one section.

Feature Name: Randomly select a subset of answers of a question
Show one question per page or one section per page
Movisens - Notes: You can structure your form on the root level by putting questions beside the sections.

Feature Name: Define and customize divider between questions (when an entire section is displayed)
Movisens - Notes: You can use Display Text with "________________" (or any other text) as the content.

Feature Name: Disable/Enable review and edit answers upon completion
Jump to any part of the survey
Movisens - Notes: WIP: Waiting for the comment on the feature name to be resolved.

Feature Name: Branching based on variables within the current survey
Movisens - Notes: Visibility rules can only be defined depending on previous items of the types Select One, Select Many, and Likert Scale.

Feature Name: Branching based on variables from other surveys
Branching based on variables from other participants
Allow researchers to fill in surveys for participants (similar to REDCap, eCRF)
View surveys as forms for faster data entry
Support creating surveys that can be answered by public without enrolling in the study (cross-sectional surveys)
MetricWire - Notes: Answers without enrolling are not supported, but there is an option "Anonymize Results" which hides PII and user ID.

Feature Name: Allow respondents to close the survey and reopen to continue responding
Response metadata - Reason for response missing (skipped vs. randomized & not selected vs. branching)
Movisens - Notes: Via a column called "Missing" for the whole form and not per each response. The values can be: Ignored = Participant did not respond to the alarm, Dismissed = Participant dismissed the alarm, Incomplete = Participant did not complete the form, Canceled_by_new_alarm = A new alarm canceled the previous alarm

Feature Name: Response metadata - Order by question as displayed to the participant
Response metadata - Open time, per-question response time, completion time, media interactions
Movisens - Notes: For the whole form they have: Trigger, Trigger Date/Time, Trigger Counter (This counter is incremented each time a trigger is executed. If multiple forms are placed after one another, then this counter has the same number for all these consecutive forms.), Form Start Date/Time, Form Finish Date/Time, Form Upload Date/Time

Feature Name: Response metadata - Participant interaction with question content's media (e.g. how much and how many times a video clip was watched)
Allow researchers to comment on individual response
Researchers can edit responses entered by other researchers (e.g. case report forms)
Researchers can edit responses entered by participants
Support for showing an external web-page within the app
Movisens - Notes: Via "Display Web-Page" form item. On request only. Also, you can specify whether it should add participant metadata to the request.

Feature Name: Counter button: a button which is shown prominently on the UI and pressing it counts a certain variable
Show all responses a participant has given to a set of questions within the app
Bar chart plot of variables defined during computation scripting

Generate statistics on responses to a survey within a group of participants

Using this option, the researcher can divide participants into a few cohorts
(e.g. by labeling them) and then calculate certain statistics on each cohort,
for example five-number summary of all responses provided to a certain
question, and show that to all participants within that cohort.
Visualize responses to a question from all participants part of a group
Display list of awards a participant has received
Display awards the participant can receive and his/her progress towards those awards
Customize the award condition based on survey progress
Movisens - Notes: On request. For each form TL, you can mark "Include Form to Gamification". If marked, the completions or incompletions will be used in gamification score calculation.

Feature Name: Define roles & assign researchers to roles
MetricWire - Notes: In MW researchers can have permission levels not specific roles.

Feature Name: Control which role can take which action on the website
Movisens - Notes: WIP: Only one permission: edit study

Feature Name: Control which role can see which part of study metadata (participants list, study protocol, etc.)
Movisens - Notes: WIP: Only one permission: read study

Feature Name: Control which role can see which data for a study (surveys, sensor data, cognitive tasks)
Movisens - Notes: WIP: Only one permission: read study

Feature Name: Different permission profiles for different study sites

Movisens - Notes: 256 Bit encrypted data transfer on all data channels (between smartphone/browser and server).

256 Bit encrypted data storage on the smartphone. Decryption of the data will happen only on the server. If a smartphone is lost by the participant, the data collected cannot be decrypted by a third person.

MetricWire - Notes: 2FA is mandatory for all Metricwire Research Accounts.

Movisens - Notes: At least 8 characters length and maximum 64 characters length, at least 1 upper case letter, at least 1 lower case letter, at least 1 special character
Either they didn't have any update between 2022-02-04 and 2024-01-31 or their release notes are outdated. Note that they don't have any update after 2024-01-31 either.

Feature Name: Support for collecting data during custom intervals
MetricWire - Notes: Researchers can set start date for the trigger.

Feature Name: Support for adjusting sampling attrbitues such as rate or accuracy
Movisens - Notes: For some of their data sources only. For example, for "Nearby Devices" you can specify "Scanning interval" and "Time Between Scans".

Feature Name: Dashboard to manage sensor-based data sources
Movisens - Notes: They say "The mobile sensing features are only available on request!". I couldn't test it.

Feature Name: Reports to monitor and visualize incoming data

Movisens - Notes: On request. Called "Location" and it uses GPS, WLAN and Cell to balance the battery usage with precision.
On request. Called "Steps".
On request. Called "Physical Activity". You can specify the minimal interval to log the physical activity, but activity may be logged more often, if requested by other apps.
On request. Called "Display On/Off".
On request. You can also limit the logs to specific apps. Just logs the app identifier.
On request. Called "Battery Level" and just logs the battery level.
Called "Nearby devices".

MetricWire - Notes: One of the limiting factors of Web Surveys is that there is only one trigger type available. Activities with Participant Portal TL are accessible in the web-based app.

Feature Name: Allow participants to see their progress in the app

Movisens - Notes: Participants can "Finish the study" when they pause the study. But it won't mark them as "dropped".

Feature Name: Allow participants to choose preferred notification channel
Allow participants to provide feedback directly via the app
Movisens - Notes: Via "Send Debug Information". I guess it's supposed to be used for "issues" though.

Feature Name: Choose columns to be shown in a table of the dashboard (customize table formats in the dashboard)

Movisens - Notes: No table is sortable even on UI.

Feature Name: Query data of a page in the dashboard
Query data of a page in the dashboard based on other data (e.g. query notification data based on participant attributes)
Query on aggregated data (e.g. more than 10 missed notifications)
Export query results (e.g. as CSV, XLSX, etc.)
Export survey responses as CSV, TSV, XLSX, or similar textual format
Movisens - Notes: They support Excel 2007 (XLSX), Comma-separated values (CSV), Semicolon-separated values (CSV), and Multimedia Results (ZIP).

Feature Name: Export sensor data in textual format
Movisens - Notes: Unisens Log File (ZIP) for all logs and Unisens Log File in minutes (XLSX) for aggregated logged data.

Feature Name: Export sensor data in sensor-specific formats (e.g. Google Earth format for GPS data)
Movisens - Notes: KMZ for only the location data with an accuracy better than 100m.

Feature Name: Interface to plot & visualize sensor data
GPS Feature Extraction using AI/ML Models
Interface to purchase and activate license online
Interface to show quota used from each license
Movisens - Notes: They have a Billing page including used credits per study.
On request as part of their InteractionDesigner (https://www.movisens.com/en/products/interactiondesigner/). Also, it seems to only support a chat-based interface.
